intro: Hibbertia polyancistra, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, woody fruits. Hibbertia polyancistra is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It is an important species for local wildlife, providing nectar for birds and insects.
